name: furniture production, wooden | wood chips, dry, measured as dry mass | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19659/documentation

This activity aims at representing the production of an average kg of wooden furniture. To do so, the life cycle inventory data of three pieces of wooden furniture retrieved from González-García et al. (2011) have been averaged. The first piece of furniture is an office table made of laminated wood with an aluminium base and textile used as a divisor. The second piece of furniture is a livingroom cupboard made of medium-density fibreboard, particleboard, natural wood and carboard filling. The last piece of furniture is a group of items (drawers, shelf and a desk) mainly made of medium-density fibreboard, particleboard and beech panels. The inputs of metal (iron, steel and aluminium) represent part of the structure and account for screw and nails. Textile inputs are integral part of the furniture. This dataset is modelled as an infrastructure, meaning that the reference product is not assigned a mass, but it has the properties of “lifetime” and “lifetime capacity”. The inventory additionally accounts for disposal of all materials.;The data is extracted from a single source. The source refers to small to medium enterprises located in located in Galicia (Northwest;Spain) and Catalonia (Northeast Spain).;Source: González-García et al. (2011) Assessing the global warming potential of wooden products from the furniture sector;to improve their ecodesign. Science of the Total Environment 410-411 (2011) 16–25.

The activity starts at the reception of the material at the factory. The activity includes the assembling and finishing of the final porduct.

The activity ends with the production of 1kg of furniture. The inventory additionally accounts for disposal of all materials. Packaging is not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/31:Manufacture of furniture/310:Manufacture of furniture/3100:Manufacture of furniture

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The start date was sent to the year of publishing of the source of reference (González-García et al. 2011). The data is considered to be still valid for the year of 2017.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The data is extracted from a single source. The source refers to small to medium enterprises located in located in Galicia (Northwest;Spain) and Catalonia (Northeast Spain).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The data is extracted from a single source. The source refers to small to medium enterprises located in located in Galicia (Northwest;Spain) and Catalonia (Northeast Spain).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
The data is extracted from a single source. The source refers to small to medium enterprises located in located in Galicia (Northwest
Spain) and Catalonia (Northeast Spain).
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Secondary literature research. Source: González-García et al. (2011) Assessing the global warming potential of wooden products from the furniture sector
to improve their ecodesign. Science of the Total Environment 410-411 (2011) 16–25.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Assumed 10% losses (expert judgement).  The value was divided by the wet mass as the flow is represented as dry mass (see the properties section).

exchanges.description: Estimated value. This infrastructure is taken as a proxy. According to the general comment of the dataset "wooden board factory construction, organic bonded boards, GLO" accessed 20170712: "The service life is assumed to be 50 years. Thus the life time output is 30'000'000 m3 board." Assuming an average density of 647 kg/m3, this density was calculated based on the weighted average of the sawnwood, laminated timber, MDF and particle board based on their inputs per kg of final product.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. The value derived from the average of the three pieces of furniture from González-García et al. 2011 of "Plastics" (0.022kg) and .  "Fabrics" (0.006kg). PET is here used as a proxy for "Fabrics", which in the description for "textiles" are mentioned as "polyester and polyurethane". Polypropylene is here used as a proxy as a plastic often used in the produciton of furniture (information retrieved from FurnitureLink https://www.furniturelinkca.com/plastics.htm, accessed 20171207).
